column4: i don't know if this will help but you might want to look at tpconfig
sudo tpconfig -t 1    should do what you want
tap and drag, right?
try 1, 2 or 3  and see which one you like :]
this seems to be a single tap then drag
without removing finger
hmm i think tpconfig isn't working in breezy....    i saw a reference to  /usr/share/doc/xorg-driver-synatptics/README.gz  for info on configuring tappad behaivor in xorg.conf
you still there?  i just activated locked drags in my xorg.conf
added           Option          "LockedDrags"           "1"
do you have tap actions at all?   like tap=click?   i'm not using gpm at all...
i don't think xorg.conf is managed by debconf
yes this should work for you i think
yes that will just replace the existing file, it doesn't look at the data inside AFAIK
this is what mine looks like  http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/8906
np was a learning experience for me ;]
there's a page on the wiki about setting that up
but they do not by default right?
Or is it only me
not by default.
is it cups' wiki you are mentioning/
this is what i used   https://help.ubuntu.com/community/NetworkPrintingWithUbuntu?highlight=%28print%29
soundray thanks but one last question. To print from Dapper A to Dapper B's printer Do I have to play with settings of Dapper A too? Or will I just change settings with the one with printer?
the howto i used replaced cupsd.conf on both machines.
